# Section Header

## Slide

::: columns
::: column
* RevealJS slides are real powerful
* Master it to precisely control and tune the layout and appearence
:::

::: column
```{python}
#| code-line-numbers: "|6|9"

import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(subplot_kw={'projection': 'polar'})
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()
```

## Interactive Python

Pydiode is a Python interpreter compiled to WebAssembly, so it runs (as a binary) within the browser:

```{pyodide-python}
n = 5
while n > 0:
  print(n)
  n = n - 1

print('Blastoff!')
```


## Another block

Subsequent blocks share the same environment, so if the previous block has been executed, the next one would run just fine:

```{pyodide-python}
print(n)
```

:::callout-note
We're using [pydiode-python](https://quarto.thecoatlessprofessor.com/pyodide/) here. Look at the docs there to learn how to load more libraries.
:::

## Interactive plots {.scrollable}

```{pyodide-python}
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np

x = np.linspace(0, 2*np.pi, 100)
y = np.sin(x)
plt.plot(x, y)
plt.title('Sine wave')
plt.show()
```
